story:
Our Story

Camp Out is the ONLY camp for gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, intersex and queer, sex and/or gender diverse and questioning teens in the whole of Australia!

Pretty incredible huh? We sure think so, that's why we, the 12 people who form the Camp Out crew, volunteer countless hours over the year to make Camp Out happen. All of us in the crew needed a camp like this when we were teenagers, a place to talk openly and honestly about our emerging identities and to be around other LGBTIQ teens with out the fear of being bullied or discriminated against, but we can't time travel, so we are doing the next best thing, making our dream a reality for the younger generation. We believe in, and have already witnessed the potential of Camp Out to deeply change young LGBTIQ youth's lives for the better! We are doing it for the love!!!


Last year saw our first ever camp, and the impact it had on the teens who came was truly phenomenal.


Here are some of the things campers have said post-camp:

 "This has been a life changing experience for me and all the other campers, and we are so grateful for all your effort you guys made to make it happen"

"IT WAS FABULOUS THANKS FOR EVERYTHING"
       
"I like that there was no discrimination with sexuality and gender, I felt comfortable all week with who I was and that was amazing"

"Camp out has been one of the best most exciting experiences I have had. I recommend it to others who are thinking of doing it. Camp Out has changed me in that I have gained confidence"



Camp Out is a place for diverse youth who share common experiences to come together and form a community that is truly their own. The camp week is filled with art, music, sports, games and other fun stuff, as well as hangouts like movie nights, beach trips and bonfires. As well as these more typical camp activities, there's open workshops and informal discussions on things like identity & what it means to be LGBTIQ-identified or questioning your gender or sexual orientation, dealing with homophobia & transphobia, coming out in highschool, coming out to parents or friends, and how to be a supportive queer ally.


For the majority of these young people, this is the only time they can talk about these issues openly and honestly, in a safe and supportive environment.

Most simply, it's the chance to hang out in a place where you're not judged for who you are, or who you like.

It is experiences like this that we believe are going to create a future generation with lower LGBTIQ youth suicide rates.


This year we are predicting to double the amount of campers that we had last year, and the registration forms are already rolling in, but we are relying on grants and the love of the community to get enough money to make the camp happen again! If we can reach our fundraising goal we will be able to meet all the costs of camp this year with out being in the red.

If you are an LGBTIQ person, think about how incredible it would have been to be a teenager and experience this kind of support, and if you are an ally to the LGBTIQ community, sending a message to youth that there are other people out there that care about their wellbeing is so powerful!


We are turning to the community to ask if you would like to see the next generation of LGBTIQ people grow up empowered, self accepting, and ready to take on the world! We cant do this with out you, so spread the word! Camp Out needs a hand!


What We Need:

We anticipate that the cost of Camp Out for 2011 will be $12,000. This includes food, transport, insurance, workshop facilitator fees, equipment, venue hire, printing and promotional material, postal costs, petrol, etc.
As a non-profit organisation, Camp Out is currently supported by a $5,000 LINC grant, as well as an upcoming fundraiser dinner (which aims to raise around $1,500), and an estimated further $2,000 from camper attendance fees.

Camp Out currently needs at least another $3,500 to go ahead.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We have a wish list of other ways to help Camp Out if you can not give financial support.

Perhaps you know someone in the 13-17 year old age range who might want to come to camp - as we're still only in our second year, we need your help in getting the word out about Camp Out!

Or perhaps you, or your workplace, or your friends, could help by donating food, sporting equipment, art supplies or other goods for the camp week - please get in contact at info@campout.org.au to find out how to lend or donate any equipment or supplies.

We are also holding a fundraising dinner at bloodwood Newtown  on Tuesday September 20th - check out the facebook event and buy tickets from Daisytickets: www.daisytickets.com

Lastly, please check out our website for updates and more information on Camp Out - www.campout.org.au

THANKYOU!!!!

story:
Short Summary

As some of you know I develop mostly KDE stuff, but last year I had a loss. So when I moved to Argentina I sold a bunch of things and had to buy them again when I came back to Brazil, there are two still that I couldn't afford: A printer and a monitor.

Stuff I develop: Apper, colord-kde, print-manager, libdebconf-kde, packagekit-qt2 and aptcc

What I Need & What You Get

The monitor is really important so I can use my desktop PC wich is far more powerfull than my work laptop, using my desktop allows me to run several VMs to test the different PackageKit backends and make sure Apper runs fine.

The printer is also important because as you know I also develop print-manager which got some real cool improvements but still misses some stuff, though it's not completly required to have a printer and do this development (which most of the time was done without real printers), I'm now in the adding a new printer phase, so yes I need a printer.

In short:

  • The monitor helps me mostly with testing my stuff on different distros and different setups.
  • In order to complete print support in KDE I need a printer to test adding new printers, checking if it's pluged, and so on..

The Impact

To understand the values:

Monitor Dell 23" costs R$ 799,00 -> ~400,00 US$ (the same one is 250$ in US, Brazil and it's abusive taxes..)

Samsung SCX-3005w costs ~ R$ 450,00 -> ~225,00 US$

I'm completely happy if I just reach the goal, so I can be more productive in my codings, if the goal is reached I'll consider your donnation as a personal help (which of course will help me keep coding in KDE).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by donating that's ok, I still need people to test, code and even write docs.

print-manager and colord-kde need especial testing since it doesn't have much users.

Thanks!

Stuff I develop: Apper, colord-kde, print-manager, libdebconf-kde, packagekit-qt2 and aptcc


What I Need & What You Get
The monitor is really important so I can use my desktop PC wich is far more powerfull than my work laptop, using my desktop allows me to run several VMs to test the different PackageKit backends and make sure Apper runs fine.
The printer is also important because as you know I also develop print-manager which got some real cool improvements but still misses some stuff, though it's not completly required to have a printer and do this development (which most of the time was done without real printers), I'm now in the adding a new printer phase, so yes I need a printer.
In short:

The monitor helps me mostly with testing my stuff on different distros and different setups.
In order to complete print support in KDE I need a printer to test adding new printers, checking if it's pluged, and so on..



The Impact
To understand the values:
Monitor Dell 23" costs R$ 799,00 -> ~400,00 US$ (the same one is 250$ in US, Brazil and it's abusive taxes..)
Samsung SCX-3005w costs ~ R$ 450,00 -> ~225,00 US$
I'm completely happy if I just reach the goal, so I can be more productive in my codings, if the goal is reached I'll consider your donnation as a personal help (which of course will help me keep coding in KDE).


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help by donating that's ok, I still need people to test, code and even write docs.
print-manager and colord-kde need especial testing since it doesn't have much users.
Thanks!

story:
Hello! My name is Cory.  My Fiancee was hospitalized for multiple Pulmonary Embolisms and will have to be on blood thinners the rest of her life as we don't have any solid answers on what caused them. (For those unfamiliar a Pulmonary Embolism is a blood clot in your lungs, which is often fatal as they can travel to your heart or brain, causing a heart attack or stroke).  Luckily it was caught in time to hopefully prevent any further danger.

At first they said no go on the honeymoon and she was crushed.  She had been saving to take a trip to Paris for many years and has never been on a major trip... let alone the fact that it is our honeymoon.  But the doctors have now approved her to go.  However medical expenses, and related expenses, are threatening our ability to pay for it now.  Deposits have been made and contracts signed, so if it all falls through we also lose some of that money.

We've been trying to keep the wedding modest (it will be at our own home) to keep costs down.  It's hard to cut corners on such an important event.  She has had a bit of a rough life and I want to make sure the start of our marriage is remembered as one of the better times of her life.

Medical expenses are expected to be in the $15k-$20k range.  I've set the goal for $15k as I am hopeful we'll be able to cover the remainder with the amount of credit we have available to us.  If you cannot contribute, but would like to, please just spread the word.

All donations will go towards paying for medical and/or wedding and honeymoon expenses.  If we actually raise enough that all the debts are paid for we plan on contributing to other worthy causes here (we just found this site and there are a lot of deserving people out there).

Contributions of $25 or more will be able to look through a photography web site we jointly run (it's really just more of a storage site for our photography, but you can order prints from it) and select any single photograph which we will send you a high quality digital image of suitable for large scale printing (most of the files can be printed at poster size and still retain good quality).  I've intentionally not set perks for more than $25 as if you have that much to contribute there are many others here that can use your help.

story:
CAMPAIGN SUCCESS..BUT YOU CAN STILL ORDER!

We now look forward to the process of fulfillment so customers stay tuned for updates!   

But if for any reason you missed your opportunity to order a CHUB Fat Bike you can still do it!!! 

      



Please note!!

All orders through InDemand have a significant delay in shipment due to current logistic issues as we locate new fulfillment manufacturer! 

Very sorry for the inconvenience. Please inquire with any questions.


A good fat bike is beautifully designed, exceptionally stout, light, ergonomic and safe...Then what does a great fat bike look like you ask?  

Well that’s simple, all of the above features and a straight forward price not inflated by multitudes of middle men....A price that you want and will gladly pay including FREE SHIPPING to all continental USA locations!  

You simply don't need to compromise on the quality of your ride; instead compromise on all those added charges keeping you from the fat bike you deserve.

Our direct sales model is the poster child of modern commerce!  We have done our research and we have heard what the average enthusiast wants and needs and we've finally arrived to deliver exactly that...Through our global partnerships with streamlined manufacturing and through economies of scale we are able to provide a refreshing new value in cycling.



...As you will see below, point by point we offer a comparable product to other mid to high end machines, complete with unparalleled warranties and customer service..But of course costing hundreds less. 

Its just how we roll, why pay more when you don't need to?  

Our CHUB Fat Tire bike has an early adopter price of only $429.00 (plus delivery) That is literally hundreds less than the nearest competitor with similar specifications..Its by far the BEST VALUE AVAILABLE!!  WHY PAY MORE? 

Our eventual full retail price of $599.00 is also way beneath the competition by a significant margin....So if you miss the boat in our early adopter specials you're still saving a bundle.


                      SPECS

·Frame : S/M/L/XL  -  CHUB 6061 Butted Aluminium Alloy with Replaceable Derailleur Hanger, Machined Tapered Headtube!

Average Weight - 34lbs 

·Delivered with MONSTER FAT TIRES (one of two styles

·Headset : CHUB Alloy

·Handlebar : CHUB Alloy

·Stem : CHUB Alloy

·Brakes : Avid Disc Brakes 160mm

·Cables : Shimano Sealed

·Rims : CHUB Alloy 100mm 32H Anodized black

·Hub Fr: CHUB Alloy

·Hub Rr : CHUB Alloy 8/9sp Shimano compatible

·Fr Derailleur : Shimano Altus

·Rr Derailleur : Shimano Altus

·Shifter (Fr&Rr) : Shimano Altus Rapid Fire - 27 gears

·Casette : Shimano Deore

·Chain : KMC 9spd

·Brake lever : CHUB Alloy Performance

·Crankset : CHUB Alloy Performance Line (arm length : 170mm)

·Bottom Bracket : Shimano Sealed

             


                                26" WHEEL CHUB DECAL COLOR OPTIONS!

                                    (Also Available in a Matte Black Decal Option) 

         

HAVE A LITTLE BOY OR GIRL? 

WANT TO RIDE TOGETHER IN STYLE?

INTRODUCING THE 20" WHEEL CHUBBIE!  

ONLY $439.00 for the WHOLE CAMPAIGN! 

(Compare to Specialized Fatboy 20 @ $995!...We are less than half)

7/8+ YEARS OLD RECOMMENDED

(Lots of adjustability as the child grows, however Please Refer to Sizing Chart)

VERY SAFE, COMES COMPLETE WITH REFLECTOR SET 

ALSO AVAILABLE IN DIFFERENT COLOR ACCENT DECALS!

                                         

PRODUCT ACCESSORIES/CAMPAIGN BENCHMARK BONUSES:

The TWIN LASER TAIL LIGHT!

The perfect addition to either the adult or children's model....The Twin Laser/LED Tail Light with Laser projected rider lanes (optional on or off) uses smart new technology ensuring additional safety when riding on roads where high visibility is imperative! Very easy to install, operates on rechargeable batteries.  Very cool.

CAMPAIGN SPECIAL...Only $35

*This optional accessory is also a Benchmark Campaign Reward once 50 Chub/Chubbie Bikes have been sold!


WATER PROOF - DUAL LENS, ULTRA BRIGHT CREE/LED HEADLIGHT!              

        

Finned Alloy Housing to Cool

Three Function (Single, Dual, Strobe) 

Power Source: 1 x 8.4V 2400mAh Battery Pack

Runtime: About 2.5 hours

Battery Charger (include):

Voltage: 100V ~ 240V

LED Indication for: Power On / Charging / Full charge

Color: Black

Weight: 486g

CAMPAIGN SPECIAL AT $60 - Available in the Perks Section

*As a Benchmark Bonus we are including this Headlight and Tail light combo in Final Retail Pricing Perk @ $599         

CHUB/CHUBBIE 

FULFILLMENT SCHEDULE

Risks and Challenges

Crowdfunding is based on the developers’ accountability towards the backers. Us towards you. Trust is therefore our most valuable asset, and we take that very, very seriously. Here are the six most important components of this Indiegogo campaign for matters relevant to you, the customer:

1. Shipping Service: 

Shipping charges are unfortunately unnavoidable, but we are absorbing a portion of these fees anticipating potential volume discounts.  listed in the Perks Section of the campaign, one must be included with every bike order. They will be arranged through USPS or UPS depending on your location. When your order is to be dispatched, you will be provided with a tracking number. As per our standards, all of our shipments are insured for their full value.  If there is an issue upon receipt or if, for some reason, the bike is damaged during shipping, we will work out a solution with you in a quick and efficient manner.

We have done it in the past with other products so we know what we're doing! Our logistics are in place and very tight...We have your back. 

2. Shipping Delays:

After manufacture, your CHUB will be shipped by ground service to all orders located in continental USA or via air delivery for all oversees orders.  Therefore, depending on where you are located shipping should take between 3-15 days once it is out of our hands.  Please note that the shipment can be delayed based on issues out of our hands as this is an early stage startup. These delays may be due to 3rd party manufacturing and fulfillment delays, also additional delays while going through customs inbound or outbound for our global clients. Our team will be available to monitor your orders and answer your question during transit.

3. Shipping Charges: 

All continental USA orders NOW HAVE FREE SHIPPING (Valued at $119) Worldwide orders require: $295.  

Nice and easy and cheaper than the competition!  Even factoring the unavoidable shipping fees we are STILL Hundreds Less Than the Competition!

4. Warranty: 

Unlike many other Indiegogo projects, we are already an incorporated company, this means we are fully accountable to our customers for any manufacturing defects and we hold customer service in the highest regard!  Each of our Chub fat tire bikes carry a lifetime warranty on the frame...Thats right LIFETIME!   Every other component carries a one year warranty. We will work with you as best we can in any situation that may arise, these are VERY durable performance machines, over engineered by design...Satisfaction guaranteed.

5. Assembly:

The bikes will be shipped 85% assembled. The wheels, handlebar, seat post as well as other minor components must be assembled upon receipt. Certain other minor adjustments might be required after assembly, such as the derailleur and the brakes. If you are not familiar with bicycle mechanics, we suggest you have it assembled by a professional in a local bike shop, or just give us a call we would be happy to talk you through basic adjustments!

6. General Feasibility:

Having previously launched multiple successful startups, we have had our share of trials and tribulations: that is the reality of all entrepreneurs. As a result, we had to work hard to execute solutions and successful action plans so we have a firm understanding of the road ahead.  It doesn’t mean that we expect a cake walk but we are ready and willing to face this challenge and follow-through with what we promise.

Act Now!  Our early adopter deals and add-on's are destined to go quick....Feel rest assured that you are going to get one hell of a fatty and at the best price.

We are certain you will love our product when it arrives, in fact we guarantee it...If for any reason you are not satisfied within 15 days of receipt and we can't seem to find a resolution via phone or email we will accept it back for a full refund minus shipping costs....Its our declaration to you that we absolutely stand by our product so you can rest assured you will be VERY HAPPY with your CHUB Fat Tire Bike.  

Thanks for checking us out, let us know if you have any questions!

story:
You could be here!

nesha is dedicated to helping you remove obstacles and nourish your soul one interaction at a time.  We do this through:

  • Yoga workshops
  • Intuitive coaching & Intention setting
  • Reiki 
We believe there's power in bringing people together…to raising your vibration and creating a sense of belonging and community…through the practice of Yin Yoga and meditation.  And that's what this campaign is helping to support:  the props necessary to help us help you on your yogic journey.

Beginning January 11th, nesha will offer monthly workshops…the first of which will be at the Athenaeum in downtown Indianapolis.  Come join us!

Your contribution will help us to fund bolsters, blankets, blocks…oh my!…and eye pillows.  In other words, your contribution goes directly to making YOUR yoga experience that much more wonderful.

How do I make that happen?

It's actually pretty simple:

  • We're asking for $1000 to fund the props needed for a typical Yin workshop (20-25 bolsters, 40 blankets, 20-25 blocks and 25 eye pillows)
  • There are several ways to donate.  Feel free to take advantage of as many of the perks as possible!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll use whatever we do raise to buy what we can for now…and we'll still honor our gifts to you.

The Impact

nesha is just starting out in our mission to help people.  And as a new young business, we're still in the process of getting the word out and building our clientele so we don't have a lot of cash in the bank.  :(

  • But we believe in what we have to offer and are seeing the benefits in the clients we do have.
  • Time is on our side…and we know we'll succeed.  We just want to make our very first yoga workshop the very best it can be.  And that's why we're buying the props!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we understand.  But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this info with friends and family to help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  It's easy….just use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Sign up for one of our upcoming workshops anyway.  We'd love to have you!

story:
In the villages of Asuohyiam, Patakro and Nankesisuhum in Ghana, many people have no choice but to drink dirty, unsafe water from the ground. Most of the time, Cholera and Guinea Worm infection are caused by this.

Pregnant women also have to drink from this water, this has major health effects on them and their unborn babies, sometimes leading to maternal death during child delivery.

Children going to school must walk about 5 to 6 miles (5 hours) in the heat every morning to search for water to help their parents do their domestic errands and to drink and bath in, and this affects their education because time is spent searching for water instead of schooling.

How will this project help?

Building mechanical hand pump wells in these villages will:

1.  Bring ease to the lives of all the inhabitants of the villages so they don't have to search for water.

2. Provide safe, pure and drinkable water for the entire community thus eradicate water-borne diseases which the villagers contract from drinking unclean water.

4. Save many lives and contribute to better education and well-being of the surrounding communities.

Further information:

It costs 3000 GHC ($900) to build each well, and by bungee jumping I am hoping to raise money towards this cause. 

The number of inhabitants in Asuohyiam, Patakro and Nankesisuhum are 500, 178 and 731 respectively. 

All the villages in need are mainly in the West Province region.

1.  Bring ease to the lives of all
the inhabitants of the villages so they don't have to search for water.
2. Provide safe, pure and drinkable water for the entire community thus eradicate water-borne diseases which the villagers contract from drinking unclean water.
4. Save many lives and contribute to better education and well-being of the surrounding communities.Further information:It costs 3000 GHC ($900) to build each well, and by bungee jumping I am hoping to raise money towards this cause. The number of inhabitants in Asuohyiam, Patakro and Nankesisuhum are 500, 178 and 731 respectively. All the villages in need are mainly in the West Province region.

story:
Meet Jessica

My name is Mirlina Hilaire and for the past 10 years I've met children in the same predicament as Jessica with parents who never imagined that their child's teeth could get to this point. Most parents genuinely feel horrible and wish they had known that this could happen to baby teeth. When asked what happened, most parents answer, "I didn't know that I had to start brushing my child's teeth as soon as they came into his mouth. By the time I noticed the cavities, my child was already in pain. I never thought this could happen to baby teeth." So I decided to start the No More Cavities Non-Profit Corporation this year to educate parents as early as possible and give them the tools necessary to create and maintain long lasting smiles.

According to the Centers of Disease Control and Prevention, although dental caries (tooth decay) is largely preventable, it remains the most common chronic disease of children aged 5-17; and it's four times more common than Asthma (42% versus 9.5%). Twenty eight percent of children ages 2-5 have already had decay in their primary (baby) teeth and 50% of children have experienced tooth decay by age 11. Low income children are twice as likely to experience decay than children of higher income families and 52 million school hours are lost each year due to dental disease.  

Your donation will help us begin a campaign to educate parents and stop this preventable childhood disease. No child should ever have to suffer! Help us stop Early Childhood Caries (ECC)!

How you can contribute

Your donations will help us give Oral Health Presentations and provide Free Dental screenings at Community Health centers, Prenatal classes, Daycares, Health Fairs, Homeless shelters, Churches and Schools. They will help us purchase disposable dental mirrors, gloves, intra-oral lights, toothbrushes, floss, and fluoride rinses.

  • Your donation of $10 will help us screen 20 kids.
  • Your donation of $20 will help us screen 40 kids.
  • Your donation of $50 will help us screen 100 kids.
  • Your donation of $100 or more, will help us screen 150+ kids and provide them with toothbrushes, floss, and a fluoride rinse to help prevent cavities.
  • Bonus: For a donation of $50 or more, you will receive a No More Cavities T-shirt to help us promote our cause!

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute at this moment, that doesn't mean you can't help us.         You can:

  • Share our website (www.no-more-cavities.org) with every parent, grandparent, guardian and care taker that you know.
  • Find us and LIKE us on Facebook (No More Cavities Non-Profit Corporation). 
  • Follow us on Twitter (#nomorecavities) and Instagram (nomorecavities) for the latest information on how to prevent ECC.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    (it's easy to do that using Indiegogo share tools).

Your contributions will make a real difference

We want to be the voice for children who don't deserve to experience Early Childhood Cavities! Give a child the chance of a healthy smile by donating to our cause today!

Our 501(c)(3) application has been submitted and is in the process of being reviewed. Once approved, all of your donations will be tax deductible.

story:
Lori is 47 years old and needs a kidney donor. She is blood type O+. Please share! For more info message this page or email kidney4lori@gmail.com. Thanks!

Biography

Lori is a loving mother who loves traveling, cooking, and scrapbooking. She's worked as a nurse for the past 20 years, and is always willing to help someone in need. Before falling ill, she traveled to India, Spain, Morocco, and Argentina. She hopes to continue exploring the world in the future.

Description

My mom lives in Casper, Wyoming. She has worked for the past twenty years as a nurse at Wyoming Medical Center. On August 4, 2013, she was working a night shift on the pediatrics wing when she began to feel ill. Less than five hours later, she was in critical condition and was rushed into emergency surgery. As we later found out, she had become infected with neisseria meningitidis, a highly fatal bacterium that can cause death in a matter of hours. In Lori’s case, the infection made her septic, sent her into multi-system organ failure, and put her in the hospital for over a month. As a result of this infection, Lori had several minor strokes, lost a portion of several toes, and has suffered permanent kidney failure. 

Despite her otherwise remarkable recovery from the meningitidis infection, Lori has been on hemodialysis since mid-August 2013. She currently goes to dialysis at the Wyoming Kidney Center three times a week for about four hours each time. She takes multiple medications and has to limit fluid intake and follow a strict diet. She’s had three different catheters and a fistula implanted in her right arm to facilitate dialysis, and is currently awaiting further surgery on her arm. 

Lori is currently listed on the national organ-sharing waitlist, but it can take many years to be matched with an organ, depending on the patient.

We are starting this page to help Lori in her search for a kidney donor, as well as starting this fundraiser to help with her medical costs. 

For more info about being tested to match Lori please call Neshiyqah Nash - the Living Donor Coordinator Assistant at the University of Colorado Hospital - (720) 848 -0855 - tell her the patient is Lori Gutierrez. Our email is: kidney4lori@gmail.com - Thank you!  


-------------------------MORE INFORMATION------------------------

Lori is 47 years old and is wait listed for a transplant but without a living donor she could wait for many years. She is blood type O+. 

A living donor candidate is a person who is healthy, well-informed and makes a voluntary decision to donate one of their kidneys. Living donors must be over 18 and usually under 70 years of age. They must be in good general health, have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of less than 30, a non-smoker, with no evidence of significant high blood pressure, diabetes, cancer, kidney disease, heart disease, or hepatitis. 

A donor can live in any state and it is important to know that all medicals costs are covered by the recipient’s health insurance. As you might imagine, donating life to another is a remarkable gift that takes a great deal of thought that can only be obtained by being well informed. 

To learn more about living donation please visit Living Donors Online:http://www.livingdonorsonline.org/kidney/kidney.htm

story:
Why PoofPads?

  • Because we all do it,
  • The ozone is depleting
  • And you have a reputation to maintain (or save).
PoofPads are effective, discrete, and there when you need them. Help make PoofPads a reality so you too can poof away - without all the embarrassment.


Do PoofPads really work?

I came up with the idea for PoofPads when a friend of mine told me that at least once a week his assistant would come into his office right after he'd just let one go. He described how embarrassing and awkward it was for both of them and that it just kept happening.

                                           

That night I mocked up the first PoofPad prototype and asked him to be my first beta tester...and it worked! Since then I have tested it myself and had a couple other friends test it out as well. They all say the same thing: "It may take a few practice poofs to make sure you direct the gas directly into the pad, but when you do PoofPad works every time!"


How do PoofPads work?

Each PoofPad contains 175 grams of activated charcoal and has the absorbent surface area of over 75,000 square meters (150 basketball courts)! PoofPads not only absorb flatulence (farts), but also other odors and gases, heavy metal ions, carcinogens and even bacteria! PoofPads can also be used as a fragrance-free deodorizer, or even a desiccant to pull excess moisture out of the air. 



Where will your money go?




    What if we don't reach your funding goal?

    You will still get your PoofPads, my ebook, audio book and one-on-one consulting! The funding goal is based on the MOQ (minimum order quantity) of the packaging manufacturer. By the way, here is the packaging design.

    The manufacturer for PoofPads is already making a similar product that I can purchase in any quantity in a clear plastic bag. They won't look as fancy, but they will work just the same ;-)


    How long do PoofPads last?

    We recommend you replace PoofPads every 4 months regardless of how often you use it. Once you open the outer bag, PoofPad begins absorbing odors, gases, water vapor, heavy metal ions, carcinogens and even bacteria! Eventually, those 75,000 square meters of activated charcoal are going to bond with something and become less effective at bonding with your malodorousness.


                  

    Caution:

    Though PoofPad may muffle the sound of your flatus (fart), it is NOT a noise-cancellation device!

story:
Hello Friends!


My name is Kate and I am a 21 year old with 17.5 inches of luscious, un-dyed, un-treated, dark brown hair that I may be parting with in 60 short days.


Many children in Canada are faced with medical illnesses and accidents that cause severe hair loss, if not complete baldness. Sometimes there is an illness that causes the hair loss (for example, alopecia), sometimes it is the treatment of an illness that causes hair loss (chemotherapy for cancer patients), and sometimes unfortunate accidents can create scalp scarring and hair loss (such as burn victims). In any case, these children need help to look themselves and live the lives they want.


That's where we come in. 

On average, it costs approximately $700.00 to create one specialized wig for a child with medical hair loss. That, plus the donation of around 10-12 ponytails of 10-12 inch human hair. 


This campaign is about raising enough money to fund the development of 3 wigs for children in Canada through the Wigs for Kids Organization. As I said, it is around $700.00 to create one specialized wig, so my goal is set at $2000.00


Those of you who are math geniuses might wonder where the additional $100.00 will be coming from? Not to worry! If I reach my goal of $2000.00 in 60 days, then I myself will donate $100.00 of my hard earned money to bring us to an even $2100.00!


Now, as though helping young children live the lives they want by looking the way they feel isn't enough motivation for you to donate, I have also agreed to send all 17.5 inches of my own hair to this wonderful cause. 

Yes, that's right I will be SHAVING MY HEAD if my goal is reached in 60 days!!


Anything counts, so whether you're able to donate $5.00 or $50.00, your kindness and generosity will be greatly appreciated.


For more information about Wigs for Kids, please click the link below.

http://www.wigsforkids.org/


If you have any questions for me, feel free to contact me at:

https://www.facebook.com/kate.smales

or e-mail me at: 

kate_smales@hotmail.com

story:
Viktor is a friend from the island Boa Vista of Cape Verde. Our paths crossed by chance while filming a documentary there. Watch the video above to learn more about the story of Viktor and how a combination of medical treatment and a guitar will help Viktor stand back on his feet.

How you can help

While the video mentions the option of purchasing the songs I recorded with Viktor, I decided to make them available for free on my website. If the songs or the story resonate with you, you are invited to help Viktor through a contribution. You could donate that what your are used to pay for a song on iTunes or any amount that feels reasonable to you. I will be personally making sure your contribution will go directly towards helping Viktor [*].

I'm excited about the idea of us contributing together on this, not only helping Viktor back on his feet but also encouraging him to continue to pour melodies and joy into his community. 

How the money will be used

Since there are limited medical facilities on the island of Boa Vista, the plan is to use the money to get Viktor to Senegal for a treatment by a specialist there. The estimated costs for this are roughly 2000 euros. The remainder of the money raised will be used towards buying a guitar for Viktor, who currently does not own a guitar, but borrows it from friends.


On behalf of Viktor, thank you for your contributions.


[*] A close friend will be traveling to Boa Vista in a few weeks. The money and guitar will be delivered by her in person to Viktor.

story:
YogaTrail is a free platform that helps yogis to find their yoga and connect with their yoga teachers and studios. Since launching in 2013, millions of people in thousands of cities have found their yoga on YogaTrail.

Our goal is to build a free mobile app that helps yogis all over the world to easily plan their practice. You can support us by selecting a perk below, or clicking the 'Contribute' button to the right of the video.

With over 100,000 yoga providers, YogaTrail has become the go-to place for unbiased information about yoga classes, providers, and events. And not just in a few big cities, but all around the world!

YogaTrail is entirely free — for everybody — be it yoga students, teachers, studios, retreat centers or teacher training schools. But the success of YogaTrail is now overwhelming us, and our small team is struggling to keep up with things. Team YogaTrail needs your help!


We’ve got amazing perks in the campaign, ranging from very small yoga accessories to some really awesome, once-in-a-lifetime experiences... and to all the sponsors that have sponsored the perks for this campaign: thank you all!

The Small Stuff

No matter how small, your support makes a big difference and is hugely appreciated. 

Get yourself some really, really Good Kharma, have us send you a personal Thank You, or get your hands on a YogaTrail Sticker Pack.

Can't contribute? We still love you — come join the YogaTrail Community here!

Mala Beads

Handmade and fair-trade (108 beads)

These handmade Mala Beads from Thailand are what you've been missing... and they'll definitely make you a better yogi!

Use them to meditate, or just to look cool — or both: look cool while meditating. Get yours now! 

Sure Design YogaTrail T-Shirt

Very Limited Edition (choose S, M, L)

They say that “Sure Design T-shirts are made to be worn by people living epic lives”, and they're totally right. The fabric is the softest cotton in the world (because it’s made by fairies, apparently).

Sure Design has partnered with YogaTrail (!) to make some very special, limited edition YogaTrail Tees for boys and girls. You can’t get these anywhere else but here and now.

Yoga with Audible Yoga

1 yr unlimited online access

Get unlimited access to all classes (normally $150!), and practice when and where it fits in your schedule and without requiring a display or an Internet connection.

You'll find a HUGE selection of yoga classes by 100 awesome teachers - snap it up here.

Yoga with Your Buddhi

1 yr unlimited online access

Yoga Buddhi (and the delightful Amanda McCarroll & Carolina Vivas) have graciously sponsored unlimited access to their online yoga for a year.

This perk comes at a 40% discount to their regular price – so jump on it (limited numbers). Even if you don’t care about supporting YogaTrail, you’ll still want to get this perk!

Now, for the most amazing perks in this campaign: 

Crowdfund Your Yoga Teacher Training or Retreat

No less than 40 exclusive spots in some of the most renowned yoga teacher training programs in the world are up for grabs – and a dozen deliciously exotic yoga retreats, too! We want you to live your dream, so here's the best part: we'll help you to crowdfund your program right here, as part of the campaign. You can earn 100% cash back simply by helping to get the word out(see below).

Browse the Teacher Training Courses here: http://asan.as/training


Browse the Selection of Retreats here: http://asan.as/retreats


How to do this: any yogi who signs up for a training program or retreat offered as a perk in this campaign will automatically be enrolled in Indiegogo’s referral program, and YogaTrail will pay you back 50% of all the contributions made by your friends, family, or other people that you invite. We'll make no profit on contributions from your referrals, full details here.

These events are exclusives: attendance is limited to just 1 spot per event. We’ll be updating the descriptions daily about which events are still up for grabs. 

Important: once you decide which program you'd like to attend, simply purchase the perk on our Indiegogo page and leave us a comment letting us know which training or retreat you've just booked (so we can remove it from the eligible perks).

So: don't let this opportunity pass you by! Learn more about how to crowd-fund your teacher training or retreat here.


This App will solve a very common problem for yoga students everywhere, namely: How to keep track of the class schedules of your favorite teachers and studios.

Why is it a problem? Because most people have several favorite teachers, and they like to take classes in more than one studio, too. But since the typical yoga instructor teaches classes in no less than 3 locations, it's a challenge to keep track of everyone’s schedule. Planning your own schedule usually means sifting through lots of studio websites and Facebook pages, and it can be very tedious just to figure out when and where you’ll be taking your next class.

The YogaTrail Mobile App will fix this and make it a breeze for yogis to keep up with their own personal yoga world (and with the larger yoga community as a whole). Anywhere and anytime.

You’ll simply ‘follow’ your favorite teachers and studios to get everyone’s classes into one place (we call it the “Class Guru”). Planning your own practice will be easy!

The App will also keep you in the loop with what’s happening: new classes, upcoming events, class changes and cancellations - you’ll be instantly notified on your phone. And from the point of view of yoga providers, that’s a lot easier than sending newsletters, text messages, or trying to use Facebook to communicate!

Just like the YogaTrail website, our mobile app will be completely free, for everyone. Teachers and studios don’t have to pay to be a part of things, and that's in contrast to any other app out there (like 'MindBody Connect' for example, which only includes the paying client studios of MindBody Software ).

What’s also different: the YogaTrail mobile app will provide awesome coverage throughout the world, not just in the larger US yoga hubs. So, you'll actually be able to use your phone to find and track your yoga when you need it most, like when you’re traveling.



With the exception of the teacher training and retreat events mentioned above, we’re also running a super-simple referral program:

Get paid 20% on contributions by everyone you invite to this page.

Huh? Yes, really. No limits, and we’re not talking about “credit towards perks” — this is real cash that you can use to buy stuff, like food at the market. Here's how it works:

  1. Sign into Indiegogo. If don't have an account, create one here. You don’t even need to support the campaign (although that’d be wonderful too) — but you must be logged in to receive credit for your referrals. 

  2. Re-visit the YogaTrail Indiegogo campaign page, where you’ll now find your unique sharing link to the left of our campaign video. Use that link to share the YogaTrail campaign on social media, email your friends and contacts, write a blog post, whatever you can think of.

  3. All the contributions from people who come in via your link are meticulously recorded by Indiegogo (and you can keep track on your own personal dashboard too). Then, at the end of the campaign, we’ll pay you using Paypal. 

Told you it's simple - share our campaign and get paid. Seems like the best way we can show you our appreciation!

Like so many other yogis, we experienced first-hand the frustration that’s involved in finding the “right” yoga classes, teachers, and places.

And online, there wasn’t anything useful for the yoga community at all — despite the fact that there are over 100 million yoga practitioners worldwide, it's the 21st century, and Google has self-driving cars! Tools like Yelp and Google really don’t work for yoga, and it became obvious (to us at least) that the yoga world needed its own network.

So, we decided to make it happen and got to work in 2012. What started off as just a small project has now become something really big... and hundreds of lovely emails from users tell us every day that we were right: the yoga community does need its own network.


We have big plans for YogaTrail — but we’re also determined to keep the platform free. We’d rather not plaster the website with ads from clothing companies or other corporates, so we’re turning to the crowd.

It also seems to us as though the crowdfunding route is the best way to collaborate with our users and with the yoga community!


Visitors to yogatrail.com might imagine a large team with lots of resources behind the scenes to make it all happen. But the reality is very different: we’re just 7 people (see below) who work way too much. YogaTrail consists of 3 developers and 4 people who do ‘all the rest’, from research and planning to design, testing, social media, writing newsletters, checking and editing all of the listings in the database and answering hundreds of daily support emails.

The success of this campaign will determine what we’ll be able to do. Various levels of funding will unlock the following:


  • $50,000: we build and release the YogaTrail mobile app in August

  • $90,000:  we upgrade our hosting (to make YogaTrail faster)!

  • $135,000: we build a suite of tools for yoga providers ("YogaTrail Pro")

  • $190,000: we build a booking platform for classes and events

  • $240,000: we make YogaTrail.com fully responsive for tablets and mobiles

  • $300,000: we translate YogaTrail into Spanish, French, and German

  • $350,000: we launch YogaTrail in Chinese and Japanese, too!

  • $500,000: we build the world's first yoga studio in Antarctica (just kidding, but we will do some really great stuff)
story_txt:
YogaTrail is a free platform that helps yogis to find their yoga and connect with their yoga teachers and studios. Since launching in 2013, millions of people in thousands of cities have found their yoga on YogaTrail.Our goal is to build a free mobile app that helps yogis all over the world to easily plan their practice. You can support us by selecting a perk below, or clicking the 'Contribute' button to the right of the video.With over 100,000 yoga providers, YogaTrail has become the go-to place for unbiased information about yoga classes, providers, and events. And not just in a few big cities, but all around the world!
YogaTrail is entirely free — for everybody — be it yoga students, teachers, studios, retreat centers or teacher training schools. But the success of YogaTrail is now overwhelming us, and our small team is struggling to keep up with things. Team YogaTrail needs your help!

We’ve got amazing perks in the campaign, ranging from very small yoga accessories to some really awesome, once-in-a-lifetime experiences... and to all the sponsors that have sponsored the perks for this campaign: thank you all!
The Small Stuff

No matter how small, your support makes a big difference and is hugely appreciated. 
Get yourself some really, really Good Kharma, have us send you a personal Thank You, or get your hands on a YogaTrail Sticker Pack.
Can't contribute? We still love you — come join the YogaTrail Community here!


Mala Beads
Handmade and fair-trade (108 beads)
These handmade Mala Beads from Thailand are what you've been missing... and they'll definitely make you a better yogi!
Use them to meditate, or just to look cool — or both: look cool while meditating. Get yours now! 


Sure Design YogaTrail T-Shirt
Very Limited Edition (choose S, M, L)
They say that “Sure Design T-shirts are made to be worn by people living epic lives”, and they're totally right. The fabric is the softest cotton in the world (because it’s made by fairies, apparently).
Sure Design has partnered with YogaTrail (!) to make some very special, limited edition YogaTrail Tees for boys and girls. You can’t get these anywhere else but here and now.


Yoga with Audible Yoga
1 yr unlimited online access
Get unlimited access to all classes (normally $150!), and practice when and where it fits in your schedule and without requiring a display or an Internet connection. You'll find a HUGE selection of yoga classes by 100 awesome teachers - snap it up here.



Yoga with Your Buddhi
1 yr unlimited online access
Yoga Buddhi (and the delightful Amanda McCarroll & Carolina Vivas) have graciously sponsored unlimited access to their online yoga for a year.
This perk comes at a 40% discount to their regular price – so jump on it (limited numbers). Even if you don’t care about supporting YogaTrail, you’ll still want to get this perk!


Now, for the most amazing perks in this campaign: 

Crowdfund Your Yoga Teacher Training or Retreat

No less than 40 exclusive spots in some of the most renowned yoga teacher training programs in the world are up for grabs – and a dozen deliciously exotic yoga retreats, too! We want you to live your dream, so here's the best part: we'll help you to crowdfund your program right here, as part of the campaign. You can earn 100% cash back simply by helping to get the word out(see below).
Browse the Teacher Training Courses here: http://asan.as/training


Browse the Selection of Retreats here: http://asan.as/retreats


How to do this: any yogi who signs up for a training program or retreat offered as a perk in this campaign will automatically be enrolled in Indiegogo’s referral program, and YogaTrail will pay you back 50% of all the contributions made by your friends, family, or other people that you invite. We'll make no profit on contributions from your referrals, full details here.
These events are exclusives: attendance is limited to just 1 spot per event. We’ll be updating the descriptions daily about which events are still up for grabs. 
Important: once you decide which program you'd like to attend, simply purchase the perk on our Indiegogo page and leave us a comment letting us know which training or retreat you've just booked (so we can remove it from the eligible perks).
So: don't let this opportunity pass you by! Learn more about how to crowd-fund your teacher training or retreat here.
This App will solve a very common problem for yoga students everywhere, namely: How to keep track of the class schedules of your favorite teachers and studios.
Why is it a problem? Because most people have several favorite teachers, and they like to take classes in more than one studio, too. But since the typical yoga instructor teaches classes in no less than 3 locations, it's a challenge to keep track of everyone’s schedule. Planning your own schedule usually means sifting through lots of studio websites and Facebook pages, and it can be very tedious just to figure out when and where you’ll be taking your next class.
The YogaTrail Mobile App will fix this and make it a breeze for yogis to keep up with their own personal yoga world (and with the larger yoga community as a whole). Anywhere and anytime.
You’ll simply ‘follow’ your favorite teachers and studios to get everyone’s classes into one place (we call it the “Class Guru”). Planning your own practice will be easy!
The App will also keep you in the loop with what’s happening: new classes, upcoming events, class changes and cancellations - you’ll be instantly notified on your phone. And from the point of view of yoga providers, that’s a lot easier than sending newsletters, text messages, or trying to use Facebook to communicate!
Just like the YogaTrail website, our mobile app will be completely free, for everyone. Teachers and studios don’t have to pay to be a part of things, and that's in contrast to any other app out there (like 'MindBody Connect' for example, which only includes the paying client studios of MindBody Software ).
What’s also different: the YogaTrail mobile app will provide awesome coverage throughout the world, not just in the larger US yoga hubs. So, you'll actually be able to use your phone to find and track your yoga when you need it most, like when you’re traveling.







With the exception of the teacher training and retreat events mentioned above, we’re also running a super-simple referral program:
Get paid 20% on contributions by everyone you invite to this page.
Huh? Yes, really. No limits, and we’re not talking about “credit towards perks” — this is real cash that you can use to buy stuff, like food at the market. Here's how it works:

Sign into Indiegogo. If don't have an account, create one here. You don’t even need to support the campaign (although that’d be wonderful too) — but you must be logged in to receive credit for your referrals. 
Re-visit the YogaTrail Indiegogo campaign page, where you’ll now find your unique sharing link to the left of our campaign video. Use that link to share the YogaTrail campaign on social media, email your friends and contacts, write a blog post, whatever you can think of.
All the contributions from people who come in via your link are meticulously recorded by Indiegogo (and you can keep track on your own personal dashboard too). Then, at the end of the campaign, we’ll pay you using Paypal. 

Told you it's simple - share our campaign and get paid. Seems like the best way we can show you our appreciation!


Like so many other yogis, we experienced first-hand the frustration that’s involved in finding the “right” yoga classes, teachers, and places.
And online, there wasn’t anything useful for the yoga community at all — despite the fact that there are over 100 million yoga practitioners worldwide, it's the 21st century, and Google has self-driving cars! So, we decided to make it happen and got to work in 2012. What started off as just a small project has now become something really big... and hundreds of lovely emails from users tell us every day that we were right: the yoga community does need its own network.


We have big plans for YogaTrail — but we’re also determined to keep the platform free. We’d rather not plaster the website with ads from clothing companies or other corporates, so we’re turning to the crowd.
It also seems to us as though the crowdfunding route is the best way to collaborate with our users and with the yoga community!


Visitors to yogatrail.com might imagine a large team with lots of resources behind the scenes to make it all happen. But the reality is very different: we’re just 7 people (see below) who work way too much. YogaTrail consists of 3 developers and 4 people who do ‘all the rest’, from research and planning to design, testing, social media, writing newsletters, checking and editing all of the listings in the database and answering hundreds of daily support emails.
The success of this campaign will determine what we’ll be able to do. Various levels of funding will unlock the following:

$50,000: we build and release the YogaTrail mobile app in August
$90,000:  we upgrade our hosting (to make YogaTrail faster)!
$135,000: we build a suite of tools for yoga providers ("YogaTrail Pro")
$190,000: we build a booking platform for classes and events
$240,000: we make YogaTrail.com fully responsive for tablets and mobiles
$300,000: we translate YogaTrail into Spanish, French, and German
$350,000: we launch YogaTrail in Chinese and Japanese, too!
$500,000: we build the world's first yoga studio in Antarctica (just kidding, but we will do some really great stuff)

story:
Greetings

We are an athletic association located in the heart of Morocco, a small mountain town of about 25,000 called Boumia.  For over 12 years now, we have been training young athletes, girls and boys, to compete and achieve success at high levels of competition.  Over time, our specialization has come to focus on track and field.  Since our founding in 1998, we have helped to develop the careers of four national & international distance champions which include Abdelqader Hachlaf, Halima Hachlaf, Hayat Allaoui, and Oulhami Hassan! 

A New Opportunity

In 2012, with help from Morocco's National Human Development Initiative, we opened our town's only public weight lifting gym.  The new gym has been a big success, and allowed us to serve our community in new ways.  One of the outcomes however, has been a large demand for handicap and injury rehabilitation services.  There is a large disabled population in our town and its five surrounding villages (Tounfit, Agbalou, Itzer, Tanwardi, and Tizit Lghashor), but there is no place for them to receive affordable treatment and in a convenient location.  This issue is close to our heart as our own founder, Silame Sidiali, who was confined to a wheel-chair after a work-related injury, suffers from this same problem.  Our campaign is about our new opportunity to meet this need, which we are prepared to do with the help of local trainers and the space in our new gym. 

What we are asking

We lack the resources to purchase the remaining equipment for this project which is why we look to you for help.  Our athletic gym is equipped with great weight-lifting material.  To launch a program for Physical Therapy though, we need more specialized material designed for rehabilitation. 

After consulting with local trainers and a doctor in Fes, we created a list of needed items and then contacted vendors in the city of Rabat to make a budget.  We highlighted the most important items to produce a realistic wish-list and budget that might go the furthest for a first-year physical therapy effort.  Our final list is made up of smaller, inexpensive items as well as a few larger ones grouped together for extremity (Arm, Leg, Hand, Finger, etc...) strengthening which many people in the community need.  These include:

Smaller Items

  • Medicine Balls / Médecine-ball jeu
  • Hand Exercise Balls / Ballon d'exercice à main
  • Circular finger exerciser / Exercice doigt
  • Weight Cuffs / Manchettes de poids  Rxis
  • Hand Gripper Exercise /  Exercice pince à main Rxis
  • Physiotherapy Gym ball / Balle de Gymnastique physiothérapie

Larger Items

  • Pedal exercise machine/ Pedale d’exercise 
  • Hand exercise Table / Tableau Exercice main
  • Parallel Bar / Bar Parallèle
  • Stair-Case with Incline / Escalier avec pente 

Since this is a new project for the association, our strategy is to proceed in stages.  With these initial items, we hope to launch the program, and then at a later date evaluate our success.  We believe that with these materials however, we can make a difference in the lives of many disabled members of our community from the start.  Your contribution will go directly toward bringing these items to our gym and toward putting many on the road to strength and recovery.   

The Impact

This project is for the benefit of the community we live in.  Since the opening of our gym, we have been approached by many community members hoping to find rehabilitation services within.  Our town Boumia is small, rural, and too far from bigger cities where physical therapy is offered.  People live modest lives here and cannot afford large travel or medical fees.  Although we had not planned on offering physical therapy, we see this problem, recognize this need, and have been preparing ourselves to address it.

We have made a plan.  Along with our President Hamid Moussaoui who holds a degree in Sports Training, our friend Jileli Dadoosh who holds a degree in Physical Sciences, and a local nurse Hamid Risee have been hired to be our trainers.  Each is to receive further training with the equipment from a doctor based in Fes, who has pledged to visit our association upon purchase of the materials. 

People here suffering from disability needs are prevented from receiving therapy due to distance and price.  With our location and our new gym, we are able to solve both of these problems.  Those from our town of Boumia, and from towns surrounding it - Tounfit, Agbalou, Tizit Lhagshore, Tanwardi, and Itzer - will be able to cut their travel time in half to nothing by us offering this service.  On top of these savings, we are able to reduce the price of therapy to nearly 25% to 50% per session of what it would cost in the city.  Rent and other overhead fees are much lower here because of our rural locale.  Plus, as a registered association with the Moroccan government, we make no more than we need to operate - the equivalent of an American non-profit.

While we had not anticipated this project, we are approaching it with the same passion and commitment that we do toward all our track and field related work.  Our responsible track record in this area earned us the rank of 36 out of 460 registered associations by the Moroccan Federation of Athleticism in 2012.  We support the pursuit of Health and Fitness through whatever means possible and for whatever population possible.  For us though, addressing physical disability is especially important as our founder, Silame Sidiali, became disabled years ago while working to harvest apples (Hear his story on our gallery page).  His energy and passion for athleticism created this association and to him we are dedicating the successful completion of this project. 

A contribution to our campaign will help us fulfill this dedication.  It will also help us provide a unique opportunity for an underprivileged and deprived population.  We ask that you help us put these friends of ours back on their feet and feeling stronger!  No contribution, big or small, will go underappreciated. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like our project but your pockets are too empty for a financial gift?  No problem, help us by sharing our campaign on your Facebook, twitter, or tell your friends, an athletic association, or the gym you go to!  We'll love you forever AND we'll feed you Moroccan couscous if you're ever in Boumia!

How we Found Indiegogo and How We're Speaking English

You may be wondering how our small athletic association in Morocco turned up on Indiegogo.  For one, despite our small size, we like to do big things!  More specifically though, our town is host to an American Peace Corp volunteer who is assisting us with this project and with translations.

story:
What are we trying to do and why?

Well, once upon a time in the tiny village of Jafre, just outside of Gerona in Spain, there was a spring with drinking water that was discovered to have healing powers. Around the spring were other springs with thermal water, also rumored to be healing. Modern science confirmed many, many years later that thermal baths and certain mineral content in water can indeed be healing for the body.

Just outside of Jafre someone bought up some land a few years back and started building a spa resort. Then recession hit and the resort was left 60% complete.

Now, a few years later the land is up for sale and many people want to turn it into commercial developments, whereas we would love to ensure that Jafre once again becomes a healing centre and that the natural beauty of the land isn’t destroyed. So we want to create Illum – a wellness centre and Eco-retreat where different holistic therapies come together with natural beauty and gastronomy. Below are images of the Illum we envision – complete with an auditorium, labyrinth, meditation pavilion, thermal baths, tree of life and of course, charming eco suites for our visitors.

 

Because of the economical crisis it is also very important for the village and the entire province where it is situated that job opportunities are created and that people start spending money in the area. Therefore the Mayor of Jafre is very excited about Illum and not only because of jobs being created, but also because of the cultural exchange that will be made available and for visitors to experience the healing benefits of the springs. (You can read an interview with the Mayor here.)

So what do we need our funds for ?

Currently it's difficult to get seed money from banks in Spain as there's an ongoing recession. We need the seed money to do the leg work to prove to investors why Illum is a feasible plan. To do this we first of all need to hire a company like HVS (www.hvs.com) whom will provide us with a complete feasibility and economical report of our project. This costs around $50,000. Then we have to pay for a number of architectural and engineering plans, research of the water, legal and financial advice and so on. That will cost another $600,000(!!!). However, the most important thing is to raise the initial $50,000. From then on it will be easier to get investors to invest the remainder of the seed money, although of course it would be nice to raise the remaining $600,000 by ourselves. (You can read a summary of what that sum of money will be used for here.)

We are already talking to investors and they are watching this campaign as we speak. Therefore it’s important for us to raise as much money as possible to prove that there is a demand from the public for Illum.

If we don’t reach the necessary amount of money we will continue fundraising through our website. Also, the more we raise, the more we can do, even if it’s not $50,000 – then we just have to start with a smaller report, or find other ways to raise the rest of the money. For example we can potentially convince someone to invest in us to breach the gap between what we have and what we need for the initial report from HVS. Every little step helps.

Who is Stan Colders, the man behind Illum?

I am an “Atmospheric-Architect” and the owner of Mind:Style. Mind:Style conceptualizes architectural design solutions and sustainable environments for a number of different kinds of businesses. I am a storyteller who from beginning to end provide guidance to architects, landscapers, interior designers, consultants and other creative specialists.

 

As a storyteller, sometimes I encounter the first seeds of a story that I truly want to be the author of. Project Illum is one such story.

Growing up I used to visit the tiny village of Jafre, in Spain just outside of Gerona rather frequently. My parents later moved there for a good couple of years, so I would continue to visit it as an adult.

Jafre is a beautiful medieval village with a mere 452 inhabitants, but what makes it so extraordinary is that it has an ancient spring, known for its healing properties. Already back in the 1400’s people gave testimonials in court that they had been cured, or watched someone cured by the spring.

One day a farmer in Jafre met a man who was crossing his fields. The man stopped to tell the farmer that the spring with its medicinal powers should be protected by a shrine. The farmer asked the man how he would know that it was the truth? The man said that a baby would die in the village and then left the farmer. The farmer set off to the village to tell the villagers what had happened and was welcomed by the church bells announcing the death of a baby. Consequently, the villagers built a shrine for the spring.

 

Today, around 600 years later I am trying to do what the man did – protect the spring by building a shrine of sorts. Because of my association with the village of Jafre, which I love, and because how much the villagers truly need more sources of income, as well as an ability to protect the land they love, this project means a lot to me. I have talked a lot to the Mayor of Jafre about this and you can read our interview with him here.

Of course I am also passionate about it because of the vision we have – the vision of building a wellness centre that heals you from the inside out. The different therapies, the beauty of the land, the food, the gardens, the spring and our thermal baths…it will create an extraordinary experience for anyone who visits.

If you support this project you are helping us create a timeless piece of magic. 

You can donate any amount (just click the “contribute” button, which is on the (almost) top right of this page) or you can buy one of our perks, which you can see on the menu to the right.

These are our perks!

Organic Cotton Hoodie or T-shirt – male/female, navy blue and white with a small gold ILLUM logo between the shoulders.

                       

 

                                          

WeWood Watch

WeWOOD lets us rediscover nature in its beauty, its simplicity and inspired design. It reminds us of a tree’s powerful way of life; rooted, yet reaching.

Completely absent of artificial and toxic materials, the WeWOOD Timepiece is as natural as your wrist. It respects your skin as you respect nature by choosing it.

One Timepiece plants one tree, and together we help to ensure the health and survival of the natural world.

One Watch – One Tree – One Planet

 

                                               

WeWOOD partners with American Forests and Trees For The Future to plant one tree for every WeWOOD purchased.

 

Shipping & Handling costs per perk :

Europe : $15

Worldwide & USA : $25

Please add with your order.

 

Get involved in more ways than donating and buying perks!

To help us preserve the spring with its natural powers you can support our campaign by:

* Liking us on Facebook www.facebook.com/ProjectIllum (or even loving us, who knows?...)

* Following us on Twitter www.twitter.com/ProjectIllum

* Spreading the word through social media – you can use the Indiegogo share buttons

* Blogging about us

* Signing up for our newsletter

* Talking to the press about us, or if you are the press, contact us on media@projectillum.com

* Sending investors our way

* Getting involved in the project yourself – email us at info@projectillum.com – whether you are an entrepreneur, hotel owner, engineer, architect, social media expert...whatever you can contribute to this project we would be grateful! 

* Give us feedback – whether about the campaign, or the project. Crowd-funding is also about crowd-sourcing – we want you to be part of our project and would love if you shared your talents with us!

Thank you so much for stopping by! Any questions you have just email us and we will get back to you ASAP!

We look forward to building the future with you!!!

Below are images of the Illum we envision – complete with an auditorium, labyrinth, meditation pavilion, thermal baths, tree of life and of course, charming eco suites for our visitors.
 
Because of the economical crisis it is also very important for the village and the entire province where it is situated that job opportunities are created and that people start spending money in the area. Therefore the Mayor of Jafre is very excited about Illum and not only because of jobs being created, but also because of the cultural exchange that will be made available and for visitors to experience the healing benefits of the springs. (You can read an interview with the Mayor here.)
So what do we need our funds for ?
Currently it's difficult to get seed money from banks in Spain as there's an ongoing recession. We need the seed money to do the leg work to prove to investors why Illum is a feasible plan. To do this we first of all need to hire a company like HVS (www.hvs.com) whom will provide us with a complete feasibility and economical report of our project. This costs around $50,000. Then we have to pay for a number of architectural and engineering plans, research of the water, legal and financial advice and so on. That will cost another $600,000(!!!). However, the most important thing is to raise the initial $50,000. From then on it will be easier to get investors to invest the remainder of the seed money, although of course it would be nice to raise the remaining $600,000 by ourselves. (You can read a summary of what that sum of money will be used for here.)
We are already talking to investors and they are watching this campaign as we speak. Therefore it’s important for us to raise as much money as possible to prove that there is a demand from the public for Illum.

If we don’t reach the necessary amount of money we will continue fundraising through our website. Also, the more we raise, the more we can do, even if it’s not $50,000 – then we just have to start with a smaller report, or find other ways to raise the rest of the money. For example we can potentially convince someone to invest in us to breach the gap between what we have and what we need for the initial report from HVS. Every little step helps.

Who is Stan Colders, the man behind Illum?
I am an “Atmospheric-Architect” and the owner of Mind:Style. Mind:Style conceptualizes architectural design solutions and sustainable environments for a number of different kinds of businesses. I am a storyteller who from beginning to end provide guidance to architects, landscapers, interior designers, consultants and other creative specialists.
 
As a storyteller, sometimes I encounter the first seeds of a story that I truly want to be the author of. Project Illum is one such story.
Growing up I used to visit the tiny village of Jafre, in Spain just outside of Gerona rather frequently. My parents later moved there for a good couple of years, so I would continue to visit it as an adult.
Jafre is a beautiful medieval village with a mere 452 inhabitants, but what makes it so extraordinary is that it has an ancient spring, known for its healing properties. Already back in the 1400’s people gave testimonials in court that they had been cured, or watched someone cured by the spring.
One day a farmer in Jafre met a man who was crossing his fields. The man stopped to tell the farmer that the spring with its medicinal powers should be protected by a shrine. The farmer asked the man how he would know that it was the truth? The man said that a baby would die in the village and then left the farmer. The farmer set off to the village to tell the villagers what had happened and was welcomed by the church bells announcing the death of a baby. Consequently, the villagers built a shrine for the spring.
 
Today, around 600 years later I am trying to do what the man did – protect the spring by building a shrine of sorts. Because of my association with the village of Jafre, which I love, and because how much the villagers truly need more sources of income, as well as an ability to protect the land they love, this project means a lot to me. I have talked a lot to the Mayor of Jafre about this and you can read our interview with him here.
Of course I am also passionate about it because of the vision we have – the vision of building a wellness centre that heals you from the inside out. The different therapies, the beauty of the land, the food, the gardens, the spring and our thermal baths…it will create an extraordinary experience for anyone who visits.
If you support this project you are helping us create a timeless piece of magic. 
You can donate any amount (just click the “contribute” button, which is on the (almost) top right of this page) or you can buy one of our perks, which you can see on the menu to the right.
These are our perks!

Organic Cotton Hoodie or T-shirt – male/female, navy blue and white with a small gold ILLUM logo between the shoulders. 

                       
 
                                           
WeWood Watch
WeWOOD lets us rediscover nature in its beauty, its simplicity and inspired design. It reminds us of a tree’s powerful way of life; rooted, yet reaching.
Completely absent of artificial and toxic materials, the WeWOOD Timepiece is as natural as your wrist. It respects your skin as you respect nature by choosing it.
One Timepiece plants one tree, and together we help to ensure the health and survival of the natural world.
One Watch – One Tree – One Planet

 
                                                
WeWOOD partners with American Forests and Trees For The Future to plant one tree for every WeWOOD purchased. 
 

Shipping & Handling costs per perk :
Europe : $15
Worldwide & USA : $25
Please add with your order.
 
Get involved in more ways than donating and buying perks!
To help us preserve the spring with its natural powers you can support our campaign by:
* Liking us on Facebook www.facebook.com/ProjectIllum (or even loving us, who knows?...)
* Following us on Twitter www.twitter.com/ProjectIllum
* Spreading the word through social media – you can use the Indiegogo share buttons
* Blogging about us
* Signing up for our newsletter
* Talking to the press about us, or if you are the press, contact us on media@projectillum.com
* Sending investors our way
* Getting involved in the project yourself – email us at info@projectillum.com – whether you are an entrepreneur, hotel owner, engineer, architect, social media expert...whatever you can contribute to this project we would be grateful! 
* Give us feedback – whether about the campaign, or the project. Crowd-funding is also about crowd-sourcing – we want you to be part of our project and would love if you shared your talents with us!
Thank you so much for stopping by! Any questions you have just email us and we will get back to you ASAP!
We look forward to building the future with you!!!

story:
My mother has been through a lot in her life. She had two abusive marriages and she worked in a factory most of her life. When I was a baby, she fell while holding me and twisted her right ankle, so she has a 4 inch screw in that ankle. She survived a blood clot in her brain, the left side of her skull is a plate. She sliced off her right thumb in a factory, it was stitched back on. She then slight her left hand index finger down to the first digit, which could not be reattached. And 3.5 years ago she was diagnosed with stage IV colon cancer that had already spread to her ovaries. She had a hysterectomy and bowel resection. In 2010 the cancer spread to liver and she had her right lobe resected. In Dec. 2011 the cancer is back, with a spoton her lung and a small tumor pushing on her right ureter which was inhibiting urine from her kidney to her bladder. Every three months she would go in to the urologist and get a stent replaced to allow urine to flow. Two weeks ago, the tumor had become so big that it twisted her bowels and she need emergency surgery to untwist her bowel. The tumor is on a major artery and could not be removed. We are currently seeking alternative treatments and will be going to Toronto's Medicor Cancer Center.

Back in her hay day, my mother had a red convertible that she loved dearly. For the past 30 years all she has ever wanted was a red convertible. My goal is to get her a used red convertible and let her drive with her top down and hair blowing before she becomes bedridden. I'm asking for funds at such short notice, hoping we can get her in her car before summer is over.

Sorry I didn't leave a video, but mom doesn't know I'm doing this, so I couldn't ask her to speak. All information can be verified with her medical records that I have copies of.

I thank you in advance for viewing this campaign.
